intro: Nemochloa extenuata, commonly known as the slender nemochloa, is a species of grass native to South America. It is characterized by its fine, delicate foliage and slender growth habit, often forming dense mats on rocky or disturbed soils. The plant has small, narrow leaves and produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to poor soil conditions. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects in degraded landscapes.
